description.narrative: (Uganda): With $3,435,919 million in FY 2020 funds, Defeat TB will substantially reduce Uganda's tuberculosis (TB) burden by 2022 and contribute to the U.S. government and World Health Organization's End TB Strategy, which seeks to end the global TB epidemic by 2035. The activity works directly with the Ministry of Health leadership to address the high TB burden in Uganda and focuses on finding missing TB cases through effective community and facility-based interventions. .Defeat TB is coordinated with other U.S. government-supported responses to TB nationwide. This includes: providing support to the National TB Leprosy program to improve the quality of the current Multi Drug-Resistant-TB program, increasing screening and detection of all forms of TB, improving early treatment initiation and completion for all diagnosed patients, and strengthening community systems to support the continuum of prevention, diagnosis, and treatment. These interventions will contribute significantly to ending the TB epidemic in Uganda and support global attainment of a world free of TB..
